intro: Lindleyella floribunda, commonly known as the clustered lindleya, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Lindleyella floribunda is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
